snippet: The 76ers were an awful team even before the roster was gutted at the trade deadline in the hope of building for the future.
abstract: Off The Dribble column; Philadelphia 76ers were an awful team even before the roster was gutted at the trade deadline in the hope of building for the future; now the team is composed of one solid veteran, one promising rookie and a cast of players so lacking in relevance that coach Brett Brown may not need to waste time learning their names.
lead_paragraph: The 76ers were an awful team even before the roster was gutted at the trade deadline in the hope of building for the future.

headline.main: By One Measure, 76ers May End Up History’s Worst
headline.print_headline: By One Measure, 76ers May End Up History’s Worst
